title: Athletes of the Week in 2015-16
text:
Athletes of the Week in 2015-16 Caption Girl Athlete of the Week (Oct. 13): Gabby Encarnacion, Bel Air soccer Baltimore Sun 
The senior forward came through in a big way last week as the No. 3 Bobcats (10-0) further solidified their lead in the Upper Chesapeake Bay Athletic Conference's Chesapeake Division. On Oct. 5, Encarnacion finished with two goals and one assist in a 4-2 win over Rising Sun. On Oct. 7, the Bobcats faced then-No. 9 Fallston and Encarnacion responded with both goals in a 2-0 win. Encarnacion, who played her first two varsity seasons at midfield, has five goals and three assists. An honor roll student who also plays basketball and competes in outdoor track, she has committed to play soccer at St. Mary's. 
Others considered: Yuliza Arguera, Northeast, soccer; Nora Feinberg, Roland Park, field hockey; Ariana Rodriguez, Roland Park, volleyball; Bri Starr, Archbishop Spalding, soccer

On Oct. 5, Encarnacion finished with two goals and one assist in a 4-2 win over Rising Sun. On Oct. 7, the Bobcats faced then-No. 9 Fallston and Encarnacion responded with both goals in a 2-0 win. Encarnacion, who played her first two varsity seasons at midfield, has five goals and three assists. An honor roll student who also plays basketball and competes in outdoor track, she has committed to play soccer at St. Mary's. 
Others considered: Yuliza Arguera, Northeast, soccer; Nora Feinberg, Roland Park, field hockey; Ariana Rodriguez, Roland Park, volleyball; Bri Starr, Archbishop Spalding, soccer (Baltimore Sun) Caption Boy Athlete of the Week (Oct. 13): Evan Fochtman, Spalding football By Matthew Cole / Capital Gazette 
The junior quarterback had a hand in all six touchdowns the No. 7 Cavaliers scored in a 42-7 win over Calvert Hall, passing for four and rushing for two. Fochtman went 13-for-23 for 276 yards and rushed 11 times for 37 yards. In the first half, he threw touchdown passes of 38 and 42 yards to C.J. Bradford and had both touchdown runs as the Cavaliers (6-1) built a 28-0 lead to remain undefeated and tied with No. 1 Gilman for first place in the MIAA A Conference. Fochtman, who started the last eight games of his sophomore season, has thrown for 1,255 yards and 18 touchdowns with one interception and has rushed 92 times for 564 yards and nine TDs. He also plays baseball for the Cavaliers. 
Others considered: Tunde Akinlosotu, McDonogh, soccer; Ken Rowe, Loyola Blakefield, cross country

Others considered: Tunde Akinlosotu, McDonogh, soccer; Ken Rowe, Loyola Blakefield, cross country (By Matthew Cole / Capital Gazette) See more galleries 
The Baltimore Sun takes Athletes of the Week nominations from Friday night until Sunday at 6 p.m. Please provide name, school, class, sport, position, team results and the athlete's accomplishments for the week, with statistics by game, and other supporting information. Coaches also should provide a number where they can be reached Sunday night. You can email your nominations to athleteoftheweek@baltimoresun.com . Katherine Dunn, Glenn Graham
